Review.Titre: They really got in my way, for no good reason
Review.Contenu: I chose these folks over the competition because their web site said they had the projector I wanted in stock, and would ship same day if I ordered before 3pm Eastern.They didn't ship it.When they didn't, I called to follow up.  I was asked a whole bunch of questions that strongly implied that I, the customer, had selected the wrong product.  When I supplied them with the use-case, distance and dimension information they insisted upon, they misinterpreted the manufacturers specifications.  I chose to cancel the order, rather than argue with them, and bought the same product for the same price elsewhere.  I don't need a really bad projector-nanny.  I'd done the math, and even put up the screen and installed an older projector with comparable specs and capabilities to check it out before I selected the product I ordered.  I know what is right for my use-case.  Your job as a retailer is to deliver the product, not withhold it until the customer has satisfied you.  That gets even worse when you don't know what you're doing.  Never again, Projector People!  You wasted my time and frustrated me - the epitome of a lousy customer experience.

I’ve purchased a projector for my business from projector people in the past with no problems. They’ve always been helpful when I’ve ordered in the past. This time, there were a couple of problems. First, I ordered a demo unit that was supposed to include free shipping. They charged me for shipping. I called customer service and they at least refunded that. When the projector came, it did not have the Wi-Fi dongle or projector mount which was clearly stated in the sale description as included in the demo unit when I purchased the projector.  I figured this was a used demo unit that just happened to have those extra items included. I sent the csr a screenshot of the description.  They failed to honor the deal and said I could pay for them as an additional charge.  They said it was a webmaster mistake. Feels like a bait and switch to me.  I told them their website was still advertising that deal and on other projectors.  I will not do business with them again.  Caveat emptor folks!

This company took my order for a replacement lamp, and immediately charged my credit card. A week later, I sent an email inquiring about the status of my order. No response. A few days later, I called. Lines are busy, with longer than average wait times. A few more days, I engaged an agent on chat. She said she accidently logged into chat, but would pass along my information. No response. A few days later, I called and left a message about my order. No response. Finally, on 5/20, I sent another email cancelling my order and requesting a refund. No response. A week later, my order shows up on my porch. No apology, and no correspondence until this review request. I kept the lamp because I had ZERO faith my money would be refunded.I understand these are challenging times, but there is ABSOLUTELY NO EXCUSE for a complete lack of communication. If you're looking for service, look somewhere else.By the way, I've been a customer since 2007.

Review.Titre: False Product Advertising Reflected On Website
Review.Contenu: I’ve heard great things about projector people. We decided to go with them to purchase a 40” diameter stand up projector screen. The product description and photo of the product both portrayed the screen with feet to stand up and balance on a table. When opened, there were no feet to balance the projector on the table. I looked at the box it came in and the box also portrayed no feet. I checked the model and product numbers and they all matched. I contacted customer support and the representative I got was very helpful and polite. He informed me that the company that manufactured the projector stopped making projectors with feet and hadn’t communicated it with Projector People and was not reflected on their website. I asked how the situation can be made right, considering we did not get what we ordered. I asked if an exchange could be done. Got short answers and was told no. All in all, a pretty terrible experience.

When I spoke to him about what I'd experienced, he apologized for the headache. I can't say that my experience  was one that I have good feelings about. I looked long and hard for a projector and was pleased with what PP  offered.  Them declining my card when the funds  were there was embarrassing.   I can't say if I will ever use them again. PP  not following up to my two messages shows a lack of customer service in my opinion.

A couple weeks ago, our projector bulb went out so I called and left a message for their Sales Team because no one was available (during open business hours).  I noted I needed assistance purchasing a bulb and was interested in purchasing another projector.   I left my contact information but didn't get a response.3. If Projector People would like to create a positive impression with me as a future user, I will gladly accept an opportunity.  Until then, I cannot speak well of them to my peers and/or colleagues.

I placed an order on a Sunday night for the Epson 2050, the site said ships in 1-2 days I paid for 2 day shipping as well as I wanted my projector up and running asap. I received a call Monday saying  the projector is on back order, even though your site still shows as available. I cancelled the order.   Latter in the day Monday I called to see if the return was completed because if it haf not been I wanted to order another projector, the benq 2040 and pay the diffrence, I was told by stacey it had been processed so I would have to wait to order it till the fund came to my bank. I called again that thursday as the funds have not been returned and the website still showed me as haveing a order prossesing. When I asked stacy about it I was told it had been done. Then a few minutes latter I get a receipts with a time stamp of that time meaning it had not been done and was only done after asking again, so who knows when this would have been done if not for my follow up. What I am most irritated about is the fact I was lied to about my refund being done, when all I wanted to do was use the refund for the other projector and pay a diffrence. And secondly the fact that the website still showed it as shipping in 1-2 days, they need to be upfront and let people know it is not in stock on the Website. I finally got my return and bought my benq 2050 from another company and would not recomend projector people to anyone. I sent emails to both Web support and sales and got to reply or apologies.
Have used several times and will continue to do so.

Review.Titre: Waiting for the order to arrive for last over 2 weeks

Review.Contenu: I usually do not write reviews but projectorpeople's service was so bad that I had to write one. It all started on Black Friday I saw the Epson 5030ube for a good price on their website with a $200 gift card, 5% discount and a free lamp rebate I pulled the trigger. I got a call the next day from Donna Taylor telling me that the projector was not in stock and will take a month to get ! I said ok ....I can wait since I was getting it at a good price. Checked on their website 2 weeks later the Epson 5030ube still showed as in stock, I contacted Donna immediately she told me they still do not have it in stock , I told her that it was misleading and wrong to have it  on their website as in stock and demanded to cancel my order, she then spoke to her manager and got my projector shipped.  I thought the worse was over...wrong ! when filing for a rebate which had 8 days left to file I found out that the serial number on the invoice was wrong again I contacted Donna and we went back and forth with several emails and after 2 days she finally got customer service to send me the corrected invoice which I mailed to the Epson rebate center but I highly doubt that the mail reached them on time since I havent heard back from them. The final nail in the coffin is the $200 gift card its been 50 days since my credit card was charged and I still havent got the gift card, on contacting Donna and going back and forth in emails she refuses to tell me the ETA of the gift card all she told me was we dont handle mailing the gift card the fulfillment center does  and there is no tracking number for it.   I have been plenty patient but I have my limits, seems to me like projector people give you good service only when you are buying from them after that they don't care much. I spoke to my bank and since I haven't got everything I was supposed to get with the projector they have agreed to do a charge back . Will never buy from them again, Beware buyers !

Review.Titre: They sent me the wrong bulb

Review.Titre: Would NOT buy from Projector People again
Review.Contenu: On 8.3.2017 we purchased an Optoma UHD65 Projector, the necessary mounting equipment and an Elite Screen AEON 135" Zero Edge Screen.  The mount/projector went up with easy - our experience was going quite well until we got to putting the Elite Screen together.  This wasn't our first rodeo - we just finished building this (new) house and had a theater room in our old house (which we still own) that had a Screen Innovations 120" - we loved this screen - could not have been easier to put together/hang.  First impression on the Elite Screen was the fit/finish/instructions were not great - we had trouble getting the 'seams' on the aluminum flush - and finally had to improvise with black electrician's tape because we were afraid the 'ridge' where the aluminum frame connected would tear the screen material as we stretched it across the frame.   Our frustration didn't stop there - we could not figure out the 'two-sided' tape that was supposed to hold the frame on the screen.  How hard can this be ... we asked ourselves???  I had two helpers - one a mechanical engineer and our son the rocket scientist (yes - he's an aeronautical engineer) - we could NOT get this part of the process completed - the tape was not 'two-sided'!  I called Projector People the next day and asked for help.  They were nice enough to get me on a conference call with the Elite Screen people.  This is where the experience really went downhill.  I was told i could just use the screen as it was (no frame) which didn't seem like an option to me as I bought it for the look of the frame.  Second option was I could go to a hardware store and buy my own tape (seriously???) or glue it???  They made me feel like an idiot because I wasn't willing to 'just go pick up some double sided tape' - didn't seem like a great answer to me.  At this point I wanted nothing to do with Elite Screens - they finally offered to send me out replacement tape - which I declined - I did not want this companies screen in my home theater.   I called the Projector People the following day - expressed my frustrations and made it clear I was not happy with this screen - I wanted to get the screen we had before (Screen Innovations) that performed flawlessly.  No problem they said - but it was going to cost me a pretty hefty re-stocking fee(?).  Yes a re-stocking fee for a product that was defective and I wasn't happy with.My initial response was to throw the Elite Screen in the trash and purchase another Screen Innovations from Best Buy.  Unfortunately that would have meant not only throwing away $500 with it - but the cost of another screen.  Since our 'old' house is on the market I took down the Elite Screen (135") and put it up at the old house - took the Screen Innovations (120") and put it up at  the new house.  Unfortunately the 'new' theater was designed around a 135" screen and the old around a 120" which meant both projectors had to be moved - ceilings repaired (holes) and seating distances changed.   Had I known Projector People did not have a 100% return policy (especially with a defective product) I would NOT have purchased anything from them.  Very disappointed.

We purchase two expensive projectors in June with delivery date in Mid- August.  I was just told now a moth past delivery date that we may-not receive them until March, which is 9 months after the purchase date.  Projector people sales have been responsive to my emails, but unable to follow through on delivery which is frustrating since these were ordered with a project need in August.
