Review.Titre: I waited up after work to call for a…
Review.Contenu: I waited up after work to call for a deal(I work overnights) since the website proclaims there awesome customer service and ability to match others prices along with lifetime tech support.  I spoke to a sales rep and asked if they could match B&H Photos price of $1389.The rep told me that was below their dealer cost and there was no way they could go below $1499.  The same week they lower their price to $1389....

Review.Titre: My projector experience was very poor
Review.Contenu: My projector experience was very poor.  I had to order it twice and it was never sent.  The third time we were guaranteed on the phone that it would arrive in time for our conference.  It arrived two days late.  The lateness was not the fault of the shipping company.  It was late because of how long it too them to process the order.

Instead of receiving the shipment in the "usual 1-2 days," it has been two weeks and I still have no idea where my projector is located. The representative was very nice and attentive, but he needed to track down the location of my projector and the reason why it wasn't delivered. After hearing from the regional VP, I think it will be shipped soon...maybe...but still no projector. I'm not happy.

Although the customer support has called and notified the day after I put my order that my projector shipment will be delayed, but I did not know it will be delayed by 3 weeks, worst thing they shipped a calibration CD for projectors w/o my projector being shipped that's dumb. They should not have taken so many order for projectors when the projectors were not in stock.

Placed an order and then they didn't have the projector in stock.  item was still listed as available even after being told it was out of stock.  projector people should probably update inventory on their listings.  sales rep was courteous, polite, and helpful.  i cancelled my order and placed an order on amazon... received it about 5 days later after waiting about 2 weeks for PP to do something about their lack of inventory.

Review.Titre: The lens sent to me is wrong ---It only works with DVD not with TV!
Review.Contenu: I bought the lens thinking would be a perfect replacement but the lens is not for PTAX200U-----It has two other projector names tied to it I tried to trouble shoot several times --but still it only works with DVD but not with TV cable ---Also I am not sure the previous lens worked perfect with HDMI and HD signal-----may be this replacement lens is not capable of receiving HD signal.------Is there anyway I can return or exchange? I have not used it at all

Original projector arrived right away, but did not work out of the box.  Customer support has been slow and required multiple calls to get the status and get instructions for return.  They would not ship a replacement until the defective projector was returned, so after 2 weeks I am still waiting for a working projector.

Placed order on 11/29/14 and paid extra for second day shipping. According to the order receipt, I was suppose to get a phone call confirming online order and an email confirmation of the order. None received. Called on December 5th to let them know the item had not arrived and was told it would ship the next week. I did receive a credit for the shipping cost. It is now December 16th and I still have not received my order or been given an type of email update on the status of the order.

Products and prices seem great, but...ready to buy a $6k product, I had a hard time getting a call back for an answer. When I finally did and then ordered, I had a hard time getting a response about shipping details. I found the service to be below average.

i paid for half month, I was told I was 2nd in line for 10 days later delivery, It is not a problem. but I  asked many times about finding a way to track my order online.  I was told the way to track my order finally with my another email and order number. It is difficult to tell me this?

Projector arrived eight days after ordered (vs three as expected).  Never received any delivery status updates, had to call to find out it was delayed and track FedEx myself.  Wish I could recommend you folks, but not after this experience.

My screen that was supposed to have an all-metal frame arrived with cheap plastic corner pieces (the most important pieces for structural integrity).  Upon calling with my durability concerns, the salesperson disputed my claim (but later recanted) that the frame was not all metal.  My biggest gripe is that to return the screen, their return policy would have put me out about $600 in restocking fees and shipping.  I would suggest you are absolutely certain you know what you are ordering (without having to trust their sales staff) before doing business with this company.

Review.Titre: I never got the rebate I was promised
Review.Contenu: When I ordered on the phone, the order entry person cautioned that I must fill in the form perfectly.  Needless to say I did just that having been pre-warned.  I never received the rebate and consider this fraud.  I would not buy from them again for this reason.

I didn't appreciate ProjectorPeople shipped me the bonus disk by FedEx w/o the projector I purchased on Black Friday. When I got the email notification that my order was shipped last Monday, I thought that my projector would finally arrived after a week delay. I was seriously considering to take a day off from work to wait for the FedEx delivery because it requires signature. Due to my meetings, I had to wait until weekend to pick it up at the local FedEx office. To my surprise and disappointment, it's just a calibration disk. I'll update my experience when I receive my projector.

Review.Titre: Make sure to ask if your projector is backordered
Review.Contenu: They seem nice, although their hours on the phone are until 7 or 8 it's best to call before 5:30 as that's when your salesperson likely leaves and they won't do anything unless your salesperson does it even if you order online like I did.  I ordered a projector and was told it would drop ship and I would receive it in 7 business days.  They did not mention it was at least 2-3 weeks before it would ship.  It was like pulling teeth to get in touch with a person who finally canceled my order.  Order cancelation did happen quickly though.  I bought the same projector from a different vendor for $100 less and received it 3 days later.

I placed my order two weeks ago and still have not received it.  There has also been no communication about my order status.  I had to call to ask why it's taking so long and still have not received a definite arrival date.

ordered a replacement lamp.   6 days later, no update on the order status had been received.  i called and after being disconnected once, was told that the lamp had been backordered and wouldn't be available for another 7 - 10 days.   i asked for the order to be cancelled so I could order it from another vendor that had the lamp in stock and was told that the order was cancelled.   after placing the order with the other vendor, i received another email from projector people stating that the lamp had been shipped and was scheduled for delivery that day!   sure enough it showed up 10 minutes later.    now I have two lamps and have to deal with the hassle of returning one...

I ordered a replacement projector lamp from Projector People on a Thursday.  By the following Monday, I had not received a single email from Projector People advising me of the status of my order.  I sent Projector People an email.  Customer Service emailed me back.  She blamed Epson for not emailing me the status of my order.  I responded back reminding her that I placed the order with Projector People, NOT Epson.  If there's anything I cannot stand it's people that try to shift the blame to someone else.  The next time I'm in the market for either a lamp or a new projector, I will check every other vendor first before returning to Projector People.  I'm reminded of an old expression; it takes months to find a new customer and seconds to lose one!

Review.Titre: Was not informed about back ordered…
Review.Contenu: Was not informed about back ordered item. Still waiting on materials to arrive. Had to order parts from another vendor to satisfy customer time like. Hard to reach sales person on phone.

Review.Titre: False Advertising on same day shipment if order placed by 3PM EST.
Review.Contenu: Their website says same day shipping if order placed by 3pm, I placed my order at 2:30pm and was told it would not ship until following Monday. I canceled my order and placed it with another vendor
I don’t know if I have emailed the correct person but I have not got a response and it’s been a month I have sent 2 emails out and nothing back…
Really good knowledge people, patient and focused on customers’ need. They gave me great comparative information on multiple brands and models and help me decide.

The prices here are fantastic.  I, unfortunately had poor delivery service.  My projector never showed.  I was told it must have been lost in the delivery.  I made contact three times and on the third call they got me my projector in 2 days.  Still waiting for my ceiling mount, again I make three calls.  Again I get the call that it too must have been lost in the delivery.  I was told to go buy my own and they will give me a credit or wait for the next ones which have been back-ordered.  It has been close to three months and I still don't have the ceiling mount, I can't get a good read on the projector for the 30 day trial, so at this point I am hoping the projector works for my purposes, and let's not forget about the carrying case.  I never got that and am afraid to call and check on that one for I am afraid it has been lost in the delivery too.

I ordered a 3 ft. SPDIF cable, and received a 6 ft SPDIF cable of a different type. I called and was told the 3ft cable was substituted for 6ft because the 3ft was discontinued. I would have appreciated knowing this beforehand, as I specifically wanted a 3ft cable.  The representative offered a refund, but told me I could not get a 3ft cable of the type I wanted, so I decided to keep the one delivered. I suggested changing the website so this problem would not arise again for another customer. Checking today, the website has NOT changed - it still lists the discontinued cable as available for sale.  The representative was pleasant enough, but I was disappointing with the lack of communication beforehand. I would have much appreciated being contacted regarding this issue before I was sent the wrong product. Additionally, it does not speak well to the business that it continues advertising a cable that has been discontinued.

Review.Titre: I’m having a lot of trouble with the…
Review.Contenu: I’m having a lot of trouble with the installation.  Can’t get any help from projector people .com or optoma customer support

Review.Titre: Three weeks later, no projector for Christmas!
Review.Contenu: Ordered Epson projector 12/1/14, credit card charged, three weeks later, no projector, shame on you PROJECTOR PEOPLE.

Review.Titre: Can't get a reply from Miguel concerning a damaged screen.
Review.Contenu: Can't get a reply from Miguel concerning a damaged screen. This is the 2nd damaged screen mishandled by FedEx in only a few weeks. I witnessed the damage happening to the 1st screen when a freight truck came to a screeching stop because he was in to big of a hurry and the screen was the only item in the trailer and it was not secured .... therefore sliding to the front and smashing the end of the container and the screen. Number two had to have been damaged somewhere. FedEx says maybe Elite is shipping bent stuff .... who knows. Elite screen company in California shifts the blame to the dealer and the dealer shifts the blame to FedEx .... there has got to be common ground somewhere.  I would be ok with a refund and keep the bent screen since I am aleady out the cost and time of 2 separate installations. I have been a long time customer but, when one of the really good guys retired (Michael) the caring for little customers seemed to decline. That's kind of descrimatory if you look at it in one sense of the word. Donna has been nice, but passes the buck. I guess ultimately, I am the loser because I paid for it and still have a damged screen. My customer suffers too ... they still have a bent screen as we wait and wait and wait. Thanks

Review.Titre: Still not have received product 2 weeks beyond quoted arrival date due to backorder.
Review.Contenu: PP should not quote arrival date without knowing product is in inventory from supplier.
I sent a message about purchasing the wrong lamp and no one responded.

Review.Titre: They routed my shipment to my billing…
Review.Contenu: They routed my shipment to my billing address instead of shipping address.
Initial connection was extremely difficult.  Incorrect numbers and no response.

Review.Titre: I ordered a couple of projectors from …
Review.Contenu: I ordered a couple of projectors from this company and have had great experiences on both in the past. Recently, I used their online chat feature to inquire about a projector and didn't receive the most friendly service. I was kind of taken aback by this. The person on the on the other end named "Lisa" called me in the middle of our instant message conversation to tell me that basically I was asking too many questions too fast and that she's the only one working there in the evening. First of all, why does the customer care that you are the only person working there? A customer just wants their questions answered. I didn't care if would take her a few minutes to respond on the chat. She tried to make me feel like I was super inconveniencing her for asking questions which was very odd. She kept stressing that she was the only person there like it was my fault I was asking questions. The funniest part is that in the instant messaging she mentioned she can call me when she has more information on the projector, then later she said I can't expect her to call me because they have so many customers that they help that calling someone personally is not possible. Well then why did you offer to call me?! Seriously it was comical. Based on this experience, it has left a seriously sour taste for me and I probably wouldn't do business with them again for this reason. There are so many other authorized projector dealers that are willing to provide excellent customer service and answer your questions in a polite manner.

Review.Titre: The projector is arriving after the…
Review.Contenu: The projector is arriving after the expected date.

Review.Titre: TK850i on sale but not in stock...

Review.Contenu: Oversold projectors. Delivery delays.

Review.Titre: 3-day shipping promised; projector arrived 30 days later -- Project People "uncaring and incompetent"
Review.Contenu: Tl;dr - I'm not one to write reviews often but my experience with Projector People can be summarized as uncaring and incompetent and definitely NOT worth your time. Ordered a HU80KA LG 4K Laser projector with "guaranteed" 3-days shipping, it came 30 days later! I reached out to Projector People multiple times that month specifically to my sales rep Sarah Buss-Fonk via phone and email. Not only was she unapologetic for the delay and kept saying it was coming in just 3-more days (untrue), when I asked for a tracking number she gave me one for an accessory that came with it instead. When the projector again didn't come after an additional week's delay, Sarah acknowledged Projector People still hadn't shipped the projector in the first place! Instead of taking responsibility for the mistake, Sarah tried to blame the manufacturer of the projector and recommended I call them to complain (and in the process named the WRONG manufacturer over email proving she wasn't paying any attention). When I explained it wasn't the manufacturer, but Projector People who guaranteed 3-day shipping, she claimed that I "could have cancelled the order at any time" and stopped responding to my calls/emails altogether asking for a refund or a discount. I called Projector People asking for a manager to call me back. No manager would talk to me and no one at Projector People attempted to call me. Instead, when I called in I was directed to voice mails that were never returned. Finally, I had to ask a poor secretary for a manager's email and put the manager on the month-long email thread with Sarah showing weeks without any response and multiple instances of Sarah telling me it has shipped when it hadn't. Only then did the manager acknowledge my request to return the unopened projector that came a month late and get a refund. 2 stars instead of 1 because once I did get approval for a refund, it was done quickly. In summary, Projector People sales reps and management was unresponsive and cowardly, hoping I would just give up and take a projector that should have come in 3-days in a month. It took many calls and emails to even get a refund for an unopened, returned projector. Small companies like this have to have good customer service. I could have gotten the projector for the same price on Amazon Prime with included 2-day shipping. Don't shop at Projector People, it is made up of people who don't care about customers.

Review.Titre: The projector I ordered works well and…
Review.Contenu: The projector I ordered works well and is of good quality. If I needed another projector in the near future, I would consider ordering from this website again, but I would be more cautious about the shipping and packaging and would hope for better customer service in case of any issues.

I recently purchased your 142 in electric screen and was not happy with the anchors provided. My screen ended up falling because of faulty anchor. I recently had your 100in screen with no issues. I believe mounting it to the floor joist would be ideal. Being it is a large screen, I think this would be more reliable. Now I have a dented screen and am currently going to attach to joist. Hopefully the screen still works. Yet, I am extremely happy with the screen itself and it’s operation but, attaching it with anchors into drywall not a safe way to go. Would you happen to know of anyone in my area (Greenfield Ca) who would fix it if it no longer works?

Review.Titre: The screen is fine (i bought the…
Review.Contenu: The screen is fine (i bought the cheapest) but the delivery process was broken.  You kept sending me shipping links that were broken.  When I went to the shipping sight and put the # in directly I could see the details, but they were confusing as it said it was shipped and delivered weeks before I received it.  I guess it had to first go to a staging sight, but no one ever mentioned to me this would happen so I wasn't sure what was up with that.

Review.Titre: My sales person did an excellent job
Review.Contenu: My sales person did an excellent job. He suggested the models and purchase went smooth. The screen is also good.However there was a minor damage on the screen. When i notified this, i was told by elite customer service that the damage happened from my home which is not true!not sure the customer support is up to mark..

Review.Titre: Received a quote and ordered the…
Review.Contenu: Received a quote and ordered the Projector.  When I received my Amex statement it reflected a higher price. When I called customer service, they told me the written quote must have been a typo.  ???
The salesperson didn't happen to mention this projector is the size of a dog house.
1  delayed  delivery 2. Come with Some cosmetic damages

Just arrived yesterday. Looks like good quality, haven't unpacked it yet, but was double boxed by Elite, and well packaged, and appears all in order.  Only issue, hence 3 stars, was the shipping company - they were impossible to work with (Pilot) - took forever, ~4 weeks after it was shipped, with no way to contact customer support, at one point was on hold for 3'45" before getting disconnected - gave up after that. I guess chalk it up to Covid......

Review.Titre: Sales POC was very helpful, but delivery was late
Review.Contenu: Sales POC was really on top of communication which is why I put 3 stars.  The only issue was the delivery time that I requested was off by 3 days.  Make sure to double check delivery times are doable with someone handling your order.  Also, if you are on the west coast, make sure to handle everything by 11am or earlier.

One of the reasons we went with Projector People was the free 2 day shipping. We wanted our projector in time for a big game we were looking forward to (trying to enjoy the simple things during this pandemic). However, the sales associates forgot they offered free 2 day shipping so unfortunately, we are going to have to wait a bit longer for our projector. Makes me wonder if they will remember the free lifetime support they say they offer too. Other than that, I would say the transaction was about what you would expect from an online retailer. Average.

I initially purchased an Optoma UHD65 projector.  After working with the projector for one hour it was clear to me that this projector was not what I was looking for.  I called my sales person & told him I wanted to return the projector.  He said he would send me a return authorization.  It ended up taking nearly a week & three phone calls before Projector People emailed me the RA.

Review.Titre: Don’t trust the chat rooms with promos
Review.Contenu: I would say not paying tax on an item was great,but not being told a promotion was a day only thing and to wait to the next day to see if they could beat a competitive price just to find out that now I don’t get the promotional item because it was over.. it’s not fare “even if it was after hour people” should of just purchased though bestbuy lesson learned.

Review.Titre: My projector was ordered with ease
Review.Contenu: My projector was ordered with ease.  I was informed the following day that the projector was out of stock and no longer available.  A very prompt refund was provided.  They were also very willing to assist me in finding a comparable projector.  I decided to order elsewhere as this was the projector that I preferred, but everyone was very professional and helpful.

Review.Titre: it was disappointing to end up with two…
Review.Contenu: it was disappointing to end up with two lens assemblies for each projector.  it should be possible to order the upgrade lens without having to also buy the standard lens and have to throw it away after finding there is no trade in value.

Had to wait until Black Friday but got a decent price on an Epson 5040UB projector. Do not believe the 2 day shipping though because once you place order you are going to be asked to call a rep. to confirm the order. I did this but did not get a call back nor an email so I did not finally get the unit got 7-8 days. Hence the 3 star rating.

The part came fast, but it was the wrong part.  Technical support was less than useful and had to call the manufacture for assistance and was still not able to resolve the issue.  They were not familiar with the part or projector, had computer problems looking up the information.  I ended up rewiring the part myself to resolve the issue.

The product arrived quickly, but the set-up instructions were inadequate and when I called for help no one seemed to know what to do.  I had to be transferred three times and was finally put in touch with the manufacturer, who also was unable to help. I may end up having to send the whole thing back and try elsewhere.

The chat was helpful in most ways but when I was close to completing my purchase I was still undecided.  The person I was chatting with said they would throw in 2 day shipping if that would make the decision easier.  I soon found out that 2 day shipping was standard on the order anyway.  They didn't throw anything extra in.  I feel that it was very misleading to present things in that manner.  Had things gone differently in that regard this would be a 5 star review but I have a very strong dislike for people being misleading.

Review.Titre: Problems with using CC with their site
Review.Contenu: Problems with using CC with their site. As soon as they called me and the person took my CC over phone it went thru immediately. The extended warranty is ridiculously high (3x) compared to Amazon. On the good side they had what I wanted in stock and it shipped and arrived when they said it would.

Review.Titre: Do not buy screen from them
Review.Contenu: I ordered a projector and a screen.  Projector came on time.  However, the screen has not been shipped yet since I ordered a week ago.  It causes so much inconvenience b/c school will start soon. We had to find some temporary solutions.  Will not recommend to order screen from them.

Review.Titre: Sales support was good but poor customer service
Review.Contenu: Sales support was very helpful in getting me the right projector for my application.  But, during set up I needed some guidance on how to adjust horizontal keystone.  I waited on hold for Customer Service for 20-30 minutes and then was disconnected.  I called back, waited another 15 minutes or so and finally gave up.  Ironically, I bought the projector from Projector People instead of Amazon because Projector People seems to have a good Customer Service reputation and my previous experience back in 2006 was exceptional.

Projector arrived quickly and was exactly as expected.  Phone call to confirm order was appreciated.   However, I was told the shipment would require a signature for drop off; but it did not.  Instead the projector was dropped off and left sitting outside in the winter (below freezing) weather.  Fortunately there was somebody at the house expecting it and brought in inside soon after it was dropped off. I called the shipping company (Fedex) and they told me that Projector People did not specify a signature for drop off.

Review.Titre: Great to work with on the front end.  Slow in getting refund on back end.
Review.Contenu: Enjoyed working with the team up front and I thought the service was great.  We returned projector that was defective and purchased a totally different model.  Again was easy.  However, the delay in getting the credit for returned unit was slow, and required a couple follow up calls on our end.

I gave 3 Stars.  First there was no friction at all.  The Sales person Carmen Aiken was most outstanding. Projector People will be sending me a return shipping label, because the projector does not work.I look forward to writing a more complete review in the near future.

Review.Titre: I haven't heard any status updates as of today 7.7.2021
Review.Contenu: I haven't heard any status updates as to where our product is.We ordered a projector and we haven't heard anything on it's status to us.We have contacted our sales rep with no email response back.

The EPSON 4000 works as expected and projector people was thorough, however I was told I needed to be present to sign for such an expensive package and schedules/delivery location were changed to accomadate this... fed ex delivered without getting a signature.

Review.Titre: I ordered a projector bulb that was …
Review.Contenu: I ordered a projector bulb that was stated on the site to be in stock. One week after ordering I had not received word that it had shipped. Upon calling them, they checked on the status of what was apparently a special order. They said they would get back to me, but two days later I contacted them again after not receiving any news. I was told that they were having difficulty getting the bulb from Epson. I asked for them to cancel my order and they did so without question and refunded my money. Communication was ok with some persistence, and they didn't argue when I asked to cancel the order. I would buy from them again.

The ordering experience was fine.  I put the projector lamp on my credit card for payment and received an invoice.  Now I have to make sure that Projector People know that the invoice is not valid.  One more step....
I received shipping instructions (tracking) two days after my order, and I have no idea which portion of my order goes with each tracking number. Did the projector ship first or the projector bulb?

The projector suggested was not a good match for us, it was way too loud. The return process was quick and satisfactory. We were disappointed overall with the experience, but the people we dealt with were courteous.

Advertised a promotion that was very good with two day shipping on the Epson 5030ub, but then could not deliver! After two weeks of waiting and still no delivery date in sight, I needed it for the Christmas holidays, so I re-ordered the more expensive 5030ube which I did not want the wifi version and will not use it, and had to pay the higher price! Projector People would not work with me on the pricing of the more expensive unit! If you're going to promote a product with two day shipping, you better have the product in stock to support your promotion!!!! VERY disappointed! Projector was awesome once installed but cost me extra money that I shouldn't have had to pay for...

Hello Projector People,New customer here, great website, great selection! I ordered a replacement projector and later realized the mount I had would not suffice. I called in an the sales rep quickly and effectively pooled some options together and offered to send them via email, great, I gave also my personal email so that I could make a decision over the weekend. I never received the email to my personal email, not in TRASH or JUNK folder, I checked. Anyhow, I researched and ordered through B&H. A seemingly small detail turned into an unpleasant experience that left me scratching my head. I'm not entirely sure whether it was an emailing, program or personal error but I hope that it gets worked out.

They have not really kept me up to sate on when my projector will ship. It has been over a week and no one has reached out to me and when I call them they just say they are waiting with no further info.

Review.Titre: I'm Struggling to Figure Out Why I Didn't Just Go to Best Buy
Review.Contenu: As the title says, I am struggling to figure out why I didn't go to Best Buy as my local store had the same price and sale. Since the SCOTUS screwed us last year and we pay sales tax on online out of state sales, it makes no sense that I bought online. Shipping was free ground and they shipped that day but it took 8 damn days to get to my house and luckily I was home as it shipped in the Epson box so anyone looking to potentially steal a package would have known exactly what they were grabbing! I'm just kind of upset as I didn't think about it until after I bought it that instead of waiting, I could have just ran to the store as I checked and they had 3 in stock. All I got from Projector People was an unnecessary wait. At least in the old days I'd have had the satisfaction of knowing I kept a few bucks out of the hands of the corrupt state politicians to fund their evil.

Review.Titre: There were delays in the shipment
Review.Contenu: There were delays in the shipment. No communication about the delay at the manufacturer, until I finally called.Dealt with PP in the past...dropped the ball this time.

Update: They reached out and refunded the order. Still, took posting here to get a response. Their website still claims 1-2 days to ship, even though it's not in stock and would have taken over a month to ship. If they have what you're ordering in stock, you'll probably have a fine experience. Just be aware everything claims 1-2 days, even when back-ordered 6+ weeks.Original review below:I have a hard time believing most of the reviews here are genuine. I tried ordering a projector lamp from them. Website claimed it ships in 1-2 days. Two weeks later, still no package, no shipping confirmation, no tracking, nothing. So I email their support. Three days later, still no response whatsoever. So I try calling their support number. Holding loop. 12 minutes in, it rings, someone picks up, and immediately hangs up without a word. So I try calling their sales number. After 20 minutes of holding I give up. This is during daytime business hours.

Review.Titre: Extra peripheral products required after purchase, extra $
Review.Contenu: Ordered projector and pop-up screen.  Both arrived in great timing.  Downside was that it was somewhat transactional.  Would have preferred a more needs based sales approach.  He did target a few options to fit my budget; however will end up spending an additional $100 ( approx ) since I needed an extra cable and a remote for my PowerPoint presentations.  For future, the sales staff should disclose the full costs based on a comprehensive needs based analysis ( extra peripherals and costs required to accomplish the full function of what the primary usage of the projector is intended ).  Tech support was not very confident in my conversation with them regarding the added cable I needed for the connection from the projector to my laptop.  Overall I believe I would use this company again but staff definitely needs training on delivering a better customer experience.

Review.Titre: customer service was great, quality of product not so much.
Review.Contenu: Projector people from the beginning were very involved in making sure my order was going smoothly and that I was pleased with their services and I was.. till I recieved my product. After about a wk of use the projector 2045 model continued to overheat and shutdown sometimes 2 or 3 times in an hour. Upon reading the diagnostic papers included in the box I find that my BRAND NEW projector has an internal error and that I should unplug the device and contact Epson. Really? Only a wk old and I'm already experiencing these types of issues? As I read on the terms and agreements, I then learn that the replacemnet model would be a refurbished device!?.... So much for spending the extra on a new device to insure a quality product was being purchased instead of a used one. Very frustrating and upsetting. Jaggies are common problem with this projector as well. Really ruins the quality of the picture and catches the eye more than I'd like.

Review.Titre: Great Order delivery But Customer Support Questionable
Review.Contenu: Got the projector on a several day delayed ship as I requested, very good, but a Help E mail I sent a week ago about set up has not been answered.
shipping is too slow, a faster shipping method needs to be provided. Other than that item arrived in good condition and works well.

Review.Titre: It should have emphasized that if the…
Review.Contenu: It should have emphasized that if the screen had to be returned it needed to be in the original box.  Otherwise everything else was fine.
Feedback and order status information was poor!Depending on how I navigated the web site, I could get two different order status.

Review.Titre: 1-2 days delivery is not guaranteed as it promotes
Review.Contenu: was supposed to come in 3 days or less but arrived closer to a week after. Missed an important event because of it.

I purchased a Panasonic AE8000U during a recent sale. The offer included free 2-day shipping, and the price was excellent. I ordered on Friday and was assured that the projector would go out that day, and should arrive by Tuesday. I hadn't received a tracking number, so I called Monday to ask for one so that I could monitor the shipment and make sure I was home to sign for the projector. The person I spoke with said that the package was on it's way and projected for delivery on Friday. When I asked why it was taking so long, I was informed that the projector was shipped ground. It turns out that even though the salesperson marked the projector for 2-day shipment, the warehouse sent it ground. It's not a major problem, more of an inconvenience, but I would think that when the company advertises free 2-day shipping, they would let the warehouse know. Also, if I had actually paid extra for the 2-day shipping and it had been shipped ground, I would have been pretty angry, so I would expect the warehouse to do a better job of paying attention to shipping method. Overall, the great price far outweighs the inconvenience of the shipping error.

Review.Titre: I would rate it higher if I had the…
Review.Contenu: I would rate it higher if I had the screen and projector. They delivered the mount but that was it.

Review.Titre: Service was good but parts were missing …
Review.Contenu: Service was good but parts were missing in box.  PP took care of the issue but it was an inconvenience.
The projector was supposed to arrive Friday, delivery was changed to Monday and then Tuesday.
Ordered 2 projectors. 1 arrived DOA. Was a hassle to get a new one. Customer service not great.

Review.Titre: Associate failed to reveal a major…
Review.Contenu: Associate failed to reveal a major downside of a $4,000 dollar projector I purchased.
Hope to get it next week - if not by next Friday (11/21/14) will be cancelling my order.
Great competent service, but a bit slow on response times and execution.

Review.Titre: you'll missed some cables in the order…
Review.Contenu: you'll missed some cables in the order and had to wait to get them in.
Their tech support is little over rated. Had a pretty average experience.
7 days for a 2 day delivery. No response after inquiry about the delay.

Review.Titre: It took longer then expected to get the…
Review.Contenu: It took longer then expected to get the projector bulb.

Review.Titre: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly...
Review.Contenu: On my first try to order a Benq HT1075 through the website, it wouldn't process (take credit card info and finish order) on first 2 tries. I then tried another one of my other pc's and was successful. When you order from ProjectorPeople you have to coordinate all your business through an assigned agent. The projector did arrive even earlier than projected which was very nice but getting tracking info was slow and the projector actually showed up at my door before I was able to get the tracking info from my agent and from the tracking deliverer. The projector itself had a glaring hotspot issue in the bottom center of the projected image with other image uniformity issues of fading focus and brightness areas at the edges. It appears this is somewhat documented online as a known issue and may be resolved with a firmware update which may be performed by the brave adventurer with the proper software but could brick the unit and/or void the warranty, and to have it done by the factory techs would cost a substantial additional amount of money for the upgrade as well as the shipping and the down time without a projector...all of which is ridiculous, as the units should be upgraded to latest firmware for free. One of the primary reasons that I bought from ProjectorPeople in the first place was because of their so called "No Hassle" return policy, which is a little misleading. So, with these issues, I requested a RMA for a refund. If you can find the "fine print" before you buy, not super easy, you have to pay for your own shipping back to ProjectorPeople and if it has over 4hrs of use, have to pay a restocking fee. My projector's lamp runtime claimed that it had 10hrs or use which was impossible as I didn't even hook it up till 5pm that day and after trying some calibration to correct the image issues and sampling the beginning of a couple of movies, I shut the projector off before 9pm, boxed it back up to send it back, so it either had been previously used or tested somewhere or the lamp runtime counter also had a defect. My agent did agree to waive the restocking fee but to assure that the projector arrived back to them with the limited return window and requirement to be insured, it was like $80 to ship it back. As an important comparison, (external reference) provides free return shipping and labels and is truly "No Hassle" as I've had to send a different model projector back to them and never threatened with a restocking fee. Lastly, it took numerous inquires as to the status of my RMA transaction, which took longer than I was quoted it would take. While the prices were very competitive at ProjectorPeople, I found the return policy, slight ordering issues, etc to be enough that I probably won't use them again.

I have done a lot of business with ProjectorPeople in the past through personal purchases and referrals to my customers amounting to 10+ projectors over the past several years.  Having purchased a new home for myself, I am installing my own theater and ordered a projector and screen on the website.  The projector was shipped quickly and worked great, as I have always come to expect from my past experience with ProjectorPeople.  I got a call after the order was placed, thanking me for my business and providing contact numbers.  The screen however was not such a great experience.  After several days of not having seen a tracking number for the screen, I finally called PP.  My sales rep was not in the office so I spoke to another rep.  I asked about the tracking number and was told that the screen was coming on Pilot freight lines, which is why I wasn't seeing a tracking number.  He told me that the screen was scheduled to be delivered on a day last week where I was going to be out of town.  I asked him if they could reschedule delivery for today, June 9, so that I could be here to sign for it.  He put me on hold and came back on the line and told me that delivery was rescheduled for today.  Since nothing had come today, I called PP again and this time spoke to my rep.  He told me that the way it worked was that I had to call Pilot to schedule a delivery time.  When I explained my earlier conversation with his colleague he told me that they can't schedule the freight delivery on their end, it has to be done by me.  When I asked "how was I supposed to know that?".  He told me that I should have been contacted with the information.  I had received no email and no calls.  He gave me the number for Pilot and the tracking number (it actually does exist).  I called Pilot and was told, "there is a note here that we weren't supposed to deliver until after June 9" (evidently communication can happen from PP to the shipper, it was just not the correct communication).  He asked me if I would like to set up a delivery time.  I was transferred to the local facility and a very helpful Pilot rep set up my delivery for tomorrow (meanwhile I waited around all day today for a shipment that would have never come had I not called PP).  Here is where it gets even more frustrating.  About 5 minutes after I got off of the phone with Pilot, I got an automated phone call from Pilot telling me that I needed to call their facility to schedule a delivery time.  Someone was asleep on this one.  It almost seems like my call to PP today woke them up and they called the shipper to get the next phase of this $100 delivery going. I am a big fan of projectors and had three in my old home (sold with the house) and just installed the first of three in my new home.  I am a big fan of ProjectorPeople, as evidenced by my business with them.  I could have purchased this projector for less money from B&H Photo or other authorized dealer, but I went with PP because of my incredible satisfaction with their service in the past.  I feel like this time around they dropped the ball despite my efforts to help them keep it in play with my call a several days ago and the revelations today.  I am hoping that there are no more surprises with the screen.  I have to admit, that with my past experience with the excellent communication from PP and their knowledge of my issues with this delivery, I am surprised that PP hasn't at least called me to follow up to make sure I have been taken care of by Pilot.  I even told my rep, "I'm going to be upset if I call Pilot and find out that delivery hasn't been scheduled for today".  My phone remains silent.  With this experience, I'm not sure that I can forego saving $50+ on the projector and mount to maintain my loyalty to PP.  Disappointed....

Review.Titre: I have bought from you in the past and…
Review.Contenu: I have bought from you in the past and still find your salesfolk and service excellent!!!

Review.Titre: Generally good, value, with one quibble.
Review.Contenu: Our order of the Benq projector left us generally satisfied but the description of the unit left out the fact that it did not have a simple plug for the audio. The instructions said you could use the phono jacks for audio, but instead the audio in has to go through the 1/8 plug while using composite video. We managed to obtain an adapter to make the unit function, but the instruction sheet is still wrong. In general, it is good value for the money, but would have confused someone not an AV geek.

Review.Titre: This BenQ GP500 is the best bang for…
Review.Contenu: This BenQ GP500 is the best bang for the buck right now. I replaced my older Sony SXRD projector and i was blown away at the picture quality and brightness. The sound of the speakers are also amazing. I have my projector mounted on the ceiling behind my couch and its projecting on a 110 inch screen. The menu is easy to navigate.  I highly recommend this projector.

Review.Titre: I've been using this projector for…
Review.Contenu: I've been using this projector for about a month. I really like the sound quality, brightness, and resolution. The time it takes to turn on is slow, but it works fine after that. The only issue is that it lacks an HDMI port, so I had to purchase an adapter to plug my laptop into it.

Quality projector. I had to get an HDMI 3-way splitter because it only has 1 hdmi port. The splitter can be found online and is not expensive. I had to also get a mini-jack to xlr cord to amplify music...
?? Projector goes off and displays: "HDMI Connection Lost"    What do you think?   Projector problem?  Or HDMI Cable problem?
was astonished how little ZOOM flexibility there is.works fine great picture.....
Ordered a laser projector, I thought transaction went well, no complaints

Review.Titre: Very good Happy customer service and our projectors…
Review.Contenu: Very good service and our projectors are working great.

Review.Titre: Unfortunately I bought a bend ht2050A I…
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately I bought a bend ht2050A I am extremely happy with the service from projector people as well as the projector itself other than I cannot connect to my 5.1 Dolby surroundsound coming from my Sony SAVA 500 system. I will contact somebody at projector people I believe they will be able to walk me through troubleshooting.

Review.Titre: Needed a high light output front…
Review.Contenu: Needed a high light output front projector for our Church sanctuary and one to display on a 150” diagonal 16 x 9 screen. This projector was recommended and was just installed. Seems to do the job. One thing that came up that the remote seems only to work by pointing at front of the projector and that is difficult as we working the the computer from its rear of it. Hopefully only need to turn  ON, then OFF ; beginning & end without any other actions during our services.

Review.Titre: I am not happy with the life of the…
Review.Contenu: I am not happy with the life of the bulb that came with the projector.  We only logged 500 hours on it before it exploded like a firecracker inside the mounted and stationary projector.  I am convinced it was a bad bulb from the time the projector was first mounted and plugged in, but we had no recourse but to pay full price for a replacement.

Review.Titre: Why had the box been opened???
Review.Contenu: I received the projector a couple days ago but haven't tried using it.The good part was that someone from the projector people called to let me know it was coming and needed a signature. The bad part was that when I received it, the box seal was broken. I have to assume it was opened but why? Now I am concerned that I got a refurbed unit. Nobody or the website said I would be receiving a refurbed unit. If it's refurbed it should have been a lot cheaper.

Good friendly customer service.  I was interested in purchasing a replacement bulb for a Mitsubishi projector and the first rep told me they no longer manufacture the bulbs and suggested I buy a new projector.  Upon my second call, the customer service rep told me they were available for sale and helped me place the order. Don't know if this was a hustle or just lack of knowledge...not good.

Review.Titre: Have been using it for 9 months with no…
Review.Contenu: Have been using it for 9 months with no problems; its working fine . Picture sharpness and brightness are great, I would have given it a 5 stars but for the " auto focus " which  it doesn't come with. Have a Panasonic projector  AE 4000 with "auto focus " which changes picture size relative to aspect ratio of movie . Go for it for its worth the money.

Projector People was easy to use, sold me a great projector at a good price, and were helpful on the phone. I've purchased from them before, recommend them with enthusiasm, and am likely to turn to them again. (Any reservations I have are directed at the industry, which I find generally user-unfriendly. This particular store is as user-friendly as possible, given the complexities of what they're selling.)

On the good side, I am able to deal with the same sales person, who knows my needs, and I buy quite a few projectors and products each year.  The down side is if I need a return or RA number, it can be days before I receive it, and my card was charged with a replacement piece, without refunding the return, so I was holding charges on 2 items.

Review.Titre: Great Product and Good Customer Service
Review.Contenu: One of my friend was recommended to buy projector from ProjectorPeople which is best especially to buy projectors for office and home theater.  Finally I bought it from them and  they have great service through online chat.  Some how it was delayed shipping due to lot of order, but finally I got the projector.BenQ Projector TK800 which is 4K projector and it is awesome to watch movies and also for office presentations.  Nice project...

Review.Titre: Lisa was very helpful and patient while…
Review.Contenu: Lisa was very helpful and patient while I consulted with her concerning which projector would be best for my home theater application. She was not a high pressure sales person. I purchased a projector and it arrived a few days later as promised. I plan to order a screen in a few days from Lisa. The Projector People appear to be a very professional organization to do business with. I would recommend them.

Review.Titre: We have been doing business with…
Review.Contenu: We have been doing business with Projector People for around 18 years.  The service and advice are always great.  I deducted one star because I never get an email with credit card backup.  I always have to call. then it is sent out immediately. It seems that small to medium projectors are going the way of the dinosaur.  I am wondering what direction your business will take.Best wishes,Alan SchaafBPM

Product was as advertised but after several days I had to call to determine the status of my order. They never called me to confirm the order, as advertised on their site. The rep said “let me check with Epson, we ordered directly from them”. Then suddenly I get a shipment notice. I think they had lost my order.

Review.Titre: no hassle purchase of replacement lamp
Review.Contenu: Tried a 3rd party lamp from elsewhere and after ~1400 hours projector indicated a lamp error and when I opened it up the housing had fractured. Bought a "real" manufacturer lamp from Projector People and the whole experience was pretty easy, though obviously the brand-name lamps are far more expensive.It will be a while until I know whether this lamp really holds up better, which is the only reason I'm not giving 5 stars.

Review.Titre: Very good selection and online guidance …
Review.Contenu: Very good selection and online guidance about making the best projector choice.  The price was competitive.  Follow-up from purchase felt good--as if they really care.  My only two reservations are that I was not made aware of an impending sale which would have saved me at least $100 and the 30 day warranty has more stipulations/restrictions than I understood when I made the purchase.

My sales rep was very helpful in finding a great solution for my projector needs. I did find tha the return process for a peripheral item (bag) that I initially ordered but didn’t like was cumbersome. It took quite some time to receive a return authorization and go through the whole process. As I was traveling this made it difficult to be efficient with my time.

Love the products but shipping was a nightmare it took about 10 days to get an shipped via FedEx how some many restriction FedEx had zip code wrong and they would not allow me do update said shipper had to change I then ask them to hold it for pickup they said again the shipper would have to change so I contacted Project People and they fix it but I am not sure I would order anything in future because I do no want to deal with FedEx.

Review.Titre: I would really give you a 3.5
Review.Contenu: I would really give you a 3.5.  The projector is great and meets our needs but the ceiling mount was very challenging to understand and has still not been put together.  We are using the old mount while we can.  The ceiling mount we purchased was supposed to alleviate our some of our problems but as we can't use it yet we are stuck.

Review.Titre: More like a fact; and that is I had to buy an entire projector to get a lamp that was out of stock.
Review.Contenu: Service was great as representative found a projector I could purchase to get the lamp out.  This happened on my second try to find a lamp, as she found a projector that the box had been opened and gave me a discount on the projector.  Projector was received the next day as promised, but still the lamp cost 1485 dollars and now I have a projector I don't need.  Service representative did great, but how did you run out of lamps to cause this crisis?

As usual, my order was processed quickly and accurately.  I ordered a new bulb for my projector on a wed evening; right after the "replace bulb" message first appeared. The new bulb arrived on mon (exactly as promised,   I've been dealing with these folks for over a decade now and they always get it right!

Projector I purchased is great, I had hoped to receive it by a certain date but it didn't arrive when I was told it would, when I called about it I was told they have no control over shipping which was disappointing.  Product is quality just disappointed in shipping.  I would purchase again just no expectation for shipping.

As far as Projector People, I an happy with my experience. My order was processed and shipped the day after I ordered it.At this point, I can't recommend the projector I ordered as it is not working right and firmware updates require an rma, but that is a manufacturer failure, not a projector people problem.

I worked with Carmen to design a rear projection system for our new church.  She did a great job of balancing our desires for great quality on a tight budget.  Carmen was great to work with.  It was difficult to connect on the phone as she seems very busy but we were able to connect easily through email.

Review.Titre: Only 4 stars because of email problems
Review.Contenu: Only 4 stars because of email problems. My "projector expert," John, was excellent to work with but the email system was messed up. I received all his emails but he was receiving NONE of mine. This made it difficult to go through the process of discussing the right equipment for my project. Got it done but it took a lot longer because he wasn't receiving my emails. (I thought I was being ignored and almost went elsewhere.) Got it all worked out by phone and fax but it was frustrating not being able to communicate with email. Get that fixed and definitely 5 stars!

The purchase process was smooth and easy.  I did my research on their site and others.  They offered plenty of help although I did not need it.  The projector arrived on time and worked as advertised.The only issue I encountered was for the ceiling mount.  I bought a "universal" mount from them about 12 years ago with another projector.  My new projector does not fit on the old ceiling mount.  The descriptions of the mounts on their website don't always describe how long their arms are, so you can't tell if they will fit your projector.  If you are planning to ceiling mount your projector ask them for help.

Everything went great. Had the projector bulb I needed (which seemed hard to find at other places). And really fast. Only reason for four instead of five stars was that it would have been good to have more of a heads up that you need to sign for the package.

I knew the make and model projector I wanted and purchasing online was easy. Projector People provided safe and timely delivery. Additionally, I like the price and  warrantee that Projector People had for the Benq TK800m projector. Great service.

Review.Titre: some things don't happen as you think they might
Review.Contenu: The shipping was really fast. I had read that PP would call to confirm the order etc but that never happened. I was somewhat frustrated because I was waiting for the call knowing it was holding up the shipping but knock knock and FEDEX was at the door.Product shipped perfectly, no issues with the box. Have not had the opportunity to try the projector but that will come in the next few days.I'm impressed with PP, their prices are great. I've not yet called them for any thing but from what I read, it seems they do the job they say they do. We'll see.

I ordered a rather low-end projector due to our extremely limited budget. I received a call following the order to confirm it and make sure I knew what I was getting. This could be viewed as helpful information about a product people often misunderstand or an attempt to upsell. I did not feel pressure to change my order given that I didn't have any funds to increase it, but did worry that I might not be happy with my order. I will report that the projector arrived quickly and works wonderfully well. We are extremely happy with it so far. It suited our needs perfectly.

Review.Titre: Sales and tech people were very prompt …
Review.Contenu: Sales and tech people were very prompt and courteous.  The only problem -- Carl, the tech guy, diagnosed over the phone that the problem was probably the bulb, which had c. 2300 hours on it out of an average life of 3000 hours. So he advised me to buy a new, expensive bulb, which I did, and which proved not to be the cause.  So I was out the 200 + dollars for the bulb (which, to be fair, would have needed replacing in a few months anyway). The point is that his advice was not accurate, although I expect he was just trying to save me money for not having to send the projector back for repair.

I was very happy with their fast service and knowledge. I was pretty set with the projectors that we were replacing, even though they carry many brands they gave me their opinion without being overly bias.Good service, fasts delivery

Review.Titre: Good price, reliable service, and they stand behind their product.
Review.Contenu: It took a little longer to get some of the equipment than I expected. It was supposed to be in stock, but it wasn't.  I did get an update, and ultimately the projector was delivered within 30 days. I've bought from them many times, and will do so again.

Review.Titre: Major issue with shipping but great otherwise
Review.Contenu: Once the issue was resolved of the item I ordered was shipped to the other side of the country they fixed it quickly. They treated me like a professional and acted as so but just keep your eye on where stuff gets shipped out to

Review.Titre: Careful of the provided screen size measurements in the item descriptions...
Review.Contenu: I wish I had known this before receiving my screen... The measurement the site provides is based on the entire projector screen dimension, NOT the viewable screen size. This is like buying a TV listed as 60inch, but in reality the actual viewable screen part is 52in, PLUS 2 inches of the bezels... false marketing IMO. I ordered 72x96" screen and expected to get that size.  Turns out 96in means 92inch + 4 inches of black borders... And since i had already setup (re: drilled holes, installed projectors and mounts) based on the site's listing, the projection is now cut of 4 inches on the sides...

Good service.  I would have given them one more star if I had known my shipment was coming from different vendors in different shipments.  I almost contacted customer support about part of my order as I had no tracking.

Review.Titre: Shipping was later then what they told…
Review.Contenu: Shipping was later then what they told me. Never got a shipping notice which worried me when spending that much money. Recommend sending those out right  away for peace of mind. Other then that everything else was great

Review.Titre: Worked with me to try a new projector …
Review.Contenu: Worked with me to try a new projector and got me in touch directly with the manufacturer to help rectify issues with the projector. We will see if the product works correctly, but if not projector people have said they will return.

Good and responsive. Kept me posted of delivery, including when manufacturer put a hold on orders for a week. Did forget to order the promised bonus projector mount, but when I reminded them they put the order right in.

While all the components ordered were received, it took a week for some of the components to ship and each item ordered was shipped separately.  Everyone seems to match pricing these days, so they price was fair to better than most.

Review.Titre: Great rep.  Weak paperwork.Fast response from sales rep and…
Review.Contenu: Fast response from sales rep and projector arrived in two days.  Pleased with that.  However did not receive paid invoice by email and shipping confirmation number in order confirmation did not link to any info.

Review.Titre: I’ve bought All my projectors for Home …
Review.Contenu: I’ve bought All my projectors for Home Theater since 2000 from this great company. Only small complaint is that 2 day shipping should stipulate it starts when manufacturer decides to send out projector not from order date.

Review.Titre: Great price, good speed, shipping could be...
Review.Contenu: I bought a projector and the price was great, discount was cool and the extra freebies (power-strip and tuning DVD) were nice. The shipping was strange - the shipping notification had two tracking numbers. Both belonged to the freebies that came well packed by FeDex with signature required. Whereas, the projector tracking was not in the notification (found it on their order page) was sent by ground shipping in its native-box with no additional packing and no signature required. All in all I would recommend as although the site said that projector purchases need to be verified by phone (which is always a hassle), it was shipped right away without any such verification.

Review.Titre: The Projector People were very helpful…
Review.Contenu: The Projector People were very helpful and offered a variety of projector ideas to fit our project with competitive prices and very helpful staff. Our projector arrived in just a few days. I will use them again.

Great customer service! They recommended a projector to my church, so we decided to purchase it. We wish that it was a little brighter, but it will suffice. Overall, good experience, will purchase from them again.

Are you kidding ? ....  Awesome Picture for just $ 549 dlls ?Exellent Colors, Black, White picture.  Almost great as other professional and more expensive projectors !Nice staff at Projector People company,

Review.Titre: I loved everything about my experience…
Review.Contenu: I loved everything about my experience however I would have liked some more guidance with how to use my first projector. Some kind of user manual or something I really had to figure things out myself.

The sales experience was great.  The Shipping experience was not great.  I needed the projector as soon as possible when buying on a Friday evening at 5pm.  We just missed the deadline for overnight on Friday leading to Monday shipping.  The Fedex shipping tag described the projector being held in FL through Tuesday meaning earliest delivery was Wednesday.  So, for the extra $62 I got a 5 day delivery.  While not your fault, I spoke to an agent on Tuesday when the projector did not arrive and was told it should be here.  It was not here.  It arrived another day later.  Meanwhile, I had to cancel customers costing me additional loss of revenue.  Again, not your fault, but I would think you might be able to contest the delivery with Fedex on my behalf.

Review.Titre: I project a bright future for the PDP Global/Projector People relationship!
Review.Contenu: The Projector People people and website are very useful and professional. The sales agent (Rich Morgan) was knowledgeable and responsive. I received the service I was needing.
Five stars if...I would make this five stars if you could get my name right.My name is Robert D Reyes and not Trixie Dailo.  Trixie used to work in this section but has since moved.Thank you.
Great website--easy to order.  The only reason for not getting 5 stars was that I had to call for shipment status.  My order arrived actually the day I called and customer service was great.

Review.Titre: The screen is great however the kit …
Review.Contenu: The screen is great however the kit that is sent with the screen to apply to the wall is very weak and will not hold anything.  Go out and buy really good wall mounts before you start your project.

Review.Titre: Good replacement lamp for NEC projector
Review.Contenu: The lamp was very well packaged when it arrived.  It took longer than expected to ship and be delivered.  If I am in an outage situation in the future, I'll have to pay extra for overnight shipping.

Review.Titre: Excellent phone support before my order…
Review.Contenu: Excellent phone support before my order and it arrived sooner than expected. If only there weren't bugs in their online ordering forcing me to call it would have been 5 stars!
I purchased a epson 2150 the first projector I recieved had a small green spot on tje screen from a pixel being out  I got ahold of epson and got a new projector customer service was awesome.

We have purchased a projector and screens some time ago.  The projector works well, but the screens did not retract.  The projector people replaced them saying that Da-Lite had a "bad batch".  We don't use them frequently, so a couple of months later, sure enough, the replacements would not retract!  Too much time had elapsed for them to replace the screens again.  However, this is a simple fix:  Don't ever buy Da-Lite screens.  I try and purchase US-made products as often as I can.  I hope I can find a different domestic manufacturer. We bought another projector from The Projector People last week.  We are very pleased with the unit.  It works very well for our room and is plenty bright.  Carmen gave us a good recommendation.

Review.Titre: Great prices; Fast shipping; Curious service
Review.Contenu: This would be a five star review if not for one thing -- their apparent need to 'upsell'.  Their prices are fantastic and their shipping was Prime-level fast.  Great website, too. But after ordering (on the website, of course), they actually called me.  On the phone.  I originally thought it was a bait-n-switch scam, since that's the way they work... but no, they really just wanted to upsell me and when I didn't bite, they shipped out what I ordered very quickly. Really, there's no valid reason to call somebody after an Internet order unless you are trying to squeeze more money out of your customer, somehow.  That's borderline sleezy these days. But other than that, my experience with Projector People was top-notch.

Now that I have had a few laps around the track, I can give a more honest review.  I like most everything about the projector (brightness, color gamut, flesh tones, etc.), so I will spend my time on what I don't like as that is what I read reviews for anyway.1) There is a ghost border (well documented) around all four sides of the image that is visible in all conditions since I do not have a black border/mask on my viewing surface. 2) I was hoping for a larger image at any given distance.  I am getting a 93" movie image at 15' of throw.3) The speaker(s) "sound" appears to be directed behind the projector and is of less quality than most TVs.  To be fair, only a few will rely on built in sound.  It is capable of getting loud depending on the source volume.

Sarah was GREAT! She was pleasant and helpful, without being pushy, in walking me through deciding which projector would meet our Church's needs for the most reasonable price. The one she suggested was not the one that came up in the online Projector Picker on the website, and, in fact, was one I had to dig to find on the website. But it was less expensive than the one the website suggested and did all the same stuff. And the price was competitive with what I was able to find for the same projector from other vendors.I went with Sarah and Projector People because of that integrity that made me feel she was as interested in my needs as much as her business' needs to make a profit.I would have given 5 stars, except the projector arrived 5 days later than Sarah said it would. If I could give 4 1/2 stars, I would.

Review.Titre: Service was quick as well as delivery
Review.Contenu: Service was quick as well as delivery, but need better communication on items if they are back ordered or coming from a different location. Other than that, good service! Thanks!

Review.Titre: My sales rep Rich was very good
Review.Contenu: My sales rep Rich was very good. His colleague who covered for him when he was out of the office… Not so much. But overall my experience with these folks was a positive one.
I liked the quick information and help selecting the projector. I didn't like the universal mount. Very difficult to put together. Took 45 min to an hour.
Easy to work with.  Told them what I needed and they pointed me in the right direction.  I was refereed to them by a company that sells out door home theater systems.

Since I first wrote this I was contacted by Tech support Nd was not able to resolve this issue, I contacted the Optoma and Optima admired the the mount was not the proper one for my new 4K. The said it should be returned and that they would correct their websit ASAP. I contacted Sarah my sales associates whom was extremely help and immediately got me a RMA with 10 min! Sarah is 5 stars from start to finish in my bookThank you Completely TERRIBLE after the sale. They drove me crazy to buy and I did, purchased the Optoma  UHZ65 w/ and Optoma MB5001 U mount. The manual doesn't list this projector and I have reached out them four times and NO one will call me or email me with help. I am NOT very happy and right now would not recommend a purchase from them. Shipping was quick, price was good, sales people friendly but horrific after the SALE!
Very helpful. The projector had the features we needed, although I found out after I purchased my projector that there was no case for it and we have a mobile setup.
My rep did a good job with getting me a good solution at a fair price. We haven't installed the product yet, so time will tell if this is the correct pieces,
Projector shipped as promised, but for got to ship the ceiling mount that was a promotion.  Called and they apologized and shipped the ceiling mount right out.
Great service as always.  Ordered the projector,  it was listed as 2 day shipping but then received a phone call it would be a week or even 2. Otherwise,  5 stars.
I've had a small disagreement in the past, but I keep coming back because they usually get things right. Never had a problem with the products I've ordered.

Review.Titre: The Optoma W400+ projector is excellent, except for lens cover.
